page.title: 07DRAYCOTT STONE
page.content: THIS IS A DOLOMITIC CONGLOMERATE WITH A REDDISH TINGE WHICH WAS ONLY FOUND AT{DRAYCOTT,}WHERE THERE WERE {THREE {QUARRIES}WHICH ARE NOW CLOSED. SOME OF THE {STONE}WAS POLISHED BY A MACHINE USING CARBORUNDUM AND FINALLY BY HAND USING {PUTTY POWDER}. THIS POLISHED STONE WAS CALLED {DRAYCOTT MARBLE}. LARGE SLABS OF STONE WERE QUARRIED AND USED FOR LINTELS, GATE POSTS ETC. WHICH CAN BE SEEN IN THE AREA NOW. THE OLDER BUILDINGS SUCH AS THE {CHURCH},{ {SCHOOL}AND {HOUSES} ARE ALL BUILT OF { {DRAYCOTT STONE} WHICH CAN BE SEEN IN A WIDE AREA AND THERE ARE FOUR POLISHED{ {DRAYCOTT STONE PILLARS}IN {WELLS {CATHEDRAL}. THE FIRST AUTHENTIC USE OF THE STONE WAS IN LATE SAXON TIMES IN { {CHEDDAR}.
